medical_history.chief_complaint: At least several days of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain associated with decreased appetite and fever.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced epigastric and RUQ pain intermittently for several weeks. Symptoms worsened significantly over the past week with severe pain and anorexia two nights prior to examination. Currently, the patient reports improvement in pain but still has tenderness on exam.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease (CAD) status post myocardial infarction (MI), hypertension (HTN), hypercholesterolemia, degenerative joint disease affecting the lumbar spine accompanied by left-sided sciatica.
